com.estimote.sdk.connection.scanner

Class ConfigurableDevicesScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.estimote.sdk.connection.scanner.ConfigurableDevicesScanner

  • public class ConfigurableDevicesScanner
extends java.lang.Object
    Finds available physical devices than can be configured using DeviceConnectionProvider. It does not create a connection by itself, but provides ConfigurableDevice data object that can be used to obtain DeviceConnection.

    Note: This scanner should not be used for long term scanning (in background). It will drain battery quickly, because it uses low latency scanning. It is intended to be used for displaying available devices in UI. It should be started in Activity.onResume() and stopped in Activity.onPause(). 

           ConfigurableDevicesScanner deviceScanner = new ConfigurableDevicesScanner(context);
       // Scan for devices own by currently logged user.
       deviceScanner.setOwnDevicesFiltering(true);
       // Scan only for second generation beacons.
       deviceScanner.setDeviceTypes(DeviceType.LOCATION_BEACON);
       deviceScanner.scanForDevices(new ConfigurableDevicesScanner.ScannerCallback() {
             @Override public void onDevicesFound(List devices) {
                for(ScanResultItem item : devices) {
                  displayDevice(item.device);
                }
         }
       });

        public void setOwnDevicesFiltering(boolean ownDevicesFiltering)
        Sets filtering for owned devices. Enabling this method requires Estimote Cloud credentials to be set using EstimoteSDK.initialize(Context, String, String).
        Parameters:
        ownDevicesFiltering - If true only devices owned by user will be returned by scanner.

      • scanForDevices

        public boolean scanForDevices(ConfigurableDevicesScanner.ScannerCallback callback)
        Starts scanning for configurable devices. Single scanner can perform one scan at the time.
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback object that will be returning found devices.
        Returns:
        True if scanning has started.

      • stopScanning

        public void stopScanning()
        Stops configurable devices scanning (only when it was previously started).
